meanings.definition: The quality or state of being central.
meanings.sent1: The centralities of the town include the main square and the town hall.
meanings.sent2: The centralities of the argument were focused on the key issues.
meanings.sent3: The centralities of the party were the clown and the magician.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was the centralities of her personality, radiating warmth to all.
meanings.sent5: The centralities of the story were the hero's journey and the final battle.

meanings.definition: The most important part of something.
meanings.sent1: In a cell, the centralities are the nucleus and mitochondria.
meanings.sent2: The centralities of a successful business are its customers and products.
meanings.sent3: The centralities of a cake are the delicious frosting and the moist sponge.
meanings.sent4: His smile was the centralities of his charm, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The centralities of a movie are the plot twists and the climax.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is central.
meanings.sent1: The centralities of a network determine its efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the centralities of a concept helps in grasping its complexity.
meanings.sent3: The centralities of a joke lie in its punchline and timing.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication was the centralities of her success, driving her towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The centralities of a map are the key locations and landmarks.
